fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.hem

Class AdjustableOutboundPort

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPort
            • fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractOutboundPort
              • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.hem.AdjustableOutboundPort
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdjustableCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.OutboundPortI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.PortI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote

    public class AdjustableOutboundPort
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.ports.AbstractOutboundPort
implements AdjustableCI
    The class AdjustableOutboundPort implements an outbound port for the AdjustableCI component interface.

    Description

    The component interface AdjustableCI is a generic interface used by the home energy manager to adjust the electricity consumption of appliances. Appliances usually do not offer this interface, so a customised connector must be use to translate calls made on the AdjustableCI interface by the HEM to calls made on the specific offered interface. Hence, in this implementation, methods tests the pre- and postconditions declared in AdjustableCI as they are not tested on the server side (which may perform other tests that the connector will have to take into account).

    Implementation Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2021-09-13

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

      • getModeConsumption

        public double getModeConsumption(int modeIndex)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: AdjustableCI
        return the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.

        Description

        According to the good practices for cyber-physical systems, the result of this method should be of type Measure<Double>, as it represents a physical value with a measurement unit. But, as one of the objective of the project is to generate the code of connectors, the limitations of Javassist, the tool used to generate code at run time, that can only compile Java 4 code, it would cause complications to use a class with a generic type.

        Contract

         pre     modeIndex > 0 && modeIndex <= maxMode()
 post    return >= 0.0
        Specified by:
        getModeConsumption in interface AdjustableCI
        Parameters:
        modeIndex - index of the new mode of operation.
        Returns:
        the power consumption in amperes of the appliance when in the mode modeIndex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        AdjustableCI.getModeConsumption(int)
